title: DOGE Analysis: 48,785 Transactions, 1,311 Duplicate Groups, and the Lowest Spend With the Highest Volume
summary: Our comprehensive DOGE-style audit of Pendle's £127 million in spending reveals the highest transaction volume of any East Lancashire council, with 1,311 duplicate payment groups and £19.5 million in suspected split payments.
author: Pendle Council Transparency

title: Companies House Compliance: Pendle's Cleanest Record Still Raises Questions
summary: Pendle paid £37,800 to four suppliers during active Companies House breaches — the lowest exposure of the three East Lancashire councils. But two suppliers filed dormant accounts while actively receiving council payments.
author: Pendle Council Transparency

title: 1,311 Duplicate Payment Groups: The Most of Any East Lancashire Council
summary: Despite having the lowest total spend, Pendle has the most duplicate payment groups — 1,311 totalling £2.7 million. The high volume of small transactions (48,785 in total) appears to drive the elevated duplication rate.
author: Pendle Council Transparency

title: 5,047 Fuel Transactions, £6M to Other Councils, and £20M in Round Numbers
summary: Pendle's spending data reveals unusual patterns: Fuelmate Ltd generated 5,047 transactions, Brentwood and Surrey councils each received £3 million in unexplained transfers, and £20.1 million was paid in suspiciously round numbers.
author: Pendle Council Transparency

title: Cross-Council Comparison: 44 Shared Suppliers and a 115,237% Price Gap
summary: Pendle shares 44 suppliers with Burnley and Hyndburn totalling £40.2 million. Both Burnley and Pendle pay Liberata UK millions for outsourced services — but Burnley pays more than double. One truck supplier shows a 115,237% price variation.
author: Pendle Council Transparency
